sen.j: 御代参街道（ごだいさんかいどう）は、江戸時代に近江国に整備された土山（現甲賀市）から小幡（現東近江市）の間約36㎞の脇街道。
sen.e: Godaisan-kaido Highway is a byway of about 36 km serviced in the Edo period in Omi Province between Tsuchiyama (current Koka City) and Obata (current Higashi Omi City).
Godaisan-kaido Highway is a byway of about 36 km serviced in the Edo period in Omi Province between Tsuchiyama (current Koka City) and Obata (current Higashi Omi City).
Godaisan-kaido Highway is a byway of about 36 km serviced in the Edo period in Omi Province between Tsuchiyama (current Koka City) and Obata (current Higashi Omi City).

sen.j: 「東海道脇街道、北国越安土道」が正式名称。
sen.e: It is formally called Tokaido-wakikaido Byway, Hokkokuetsu Azuchi-do Road.
It is formally called 'Tokaido-wakikaido Byway, Hokkokuetsu Azuchi-do Road.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: It is formally called 'Tokaido-wakikaido Byway, Hokkokuetsu Azuchi-do Road.'

sen.j: 伊勢道、市道とも。
sen.e: It is also called Ise-do Road or Ichi-do Road.
It is also called Ise-do Road or Ichi-do Road.
It is also called Ise-do Road or Ichi-do Road.

sen.j: 春日局が1640年（寛永17年）に伊勢神宮から多賀大社へ参詣した際に整備されたと伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said that the highway was maintenanced when Kasuga-no Tsubone made her pilgrimage from Ise-jingu Shrine to Taga-taisha Shrine in 1640.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: It is said that the highway was maintained when Kasuga no Tsubone made her pilgrimage from Ise-jingu Shrine to Taga-taisha Shrine in 1640.
sen.cmt: maintained に訂正しました。ハイフン削除し、スペース補足しました。
sen.e: It is said that the highway was maintained when Kasuga no Tsubone made her pilgrimage from Ise-jingu Shrine to Taga-taisha Shrine in 1640.

sen.j: 江戸中期頃には京の公卿たちの間で年に3回（正月・五月・九月）伊勢神宮と多賀社へ代参の名代を派遣する習慣がありその際に利用されたことから御代参街道と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The Highway is called Godaisan (meaning visiting in place of another)-kaido Highway because in the mid-Edo period there was a tradition among the courtiers in Kyoto to send a representative to Ise-jingu shrine and to Taga-taisha Shrine three times a year (New Year, May and September), and the highway was used in those occasions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: The Highway is called Godaisan (meaning visiting in place of another)-kaido Highway because in the mid-Edo period there was a tradition among the courtiers in Kyoto to send a representative to Ise-jingu Shrine and to Taga-taisha Shrine three times a year (New Year, May and September), and the highway was used in those occasions.

The Highway is called Godaisan (meaning visiting in place of another)-kaido Highway because in the mid-Edo period there was a tradition among the courtiers in Kyoto to send a representative to Ise-jingu Shrine and to Taga-taisha Shrine three times a year (New Year, May and September), and the highway was used in those occasions.

sen.j: ただし江戸期の文献には「御代参街道」との記述はみられず1868年（慶応4年）の記述が初見である。
sen.e: However, there is no mention of Godaisan-kaido Highway in documents or records of the Edo period, and it was only in 1868 that the name began to appear.
However, there is no mention of 'Godaisan-kaido Highway' in documents or records of the Edo period, and it was only in 1868 that the name began to appear.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: However, there is no mention of 'Godaisan-kaido Highway' in documents or records of the Edo period, and it was only in 1868 that the name began to appear.

sen.j: また、東海道土山宿の道標には「右北国たが街道 ひの八まん道」とあることから、北国への最短経路としても利用されていたと考えられる。
sen.e: Since there is a "to the right, Hokkoku Taga Highway, Hino Hachiman Road" road sign in the Tokaido Tsuchiyama post town, the highway must have been used as the shortest route to Hokkoku.
Since there is a 'to the right, Hokkoku Taga Highway, Hino Hachiman Road' road sign in the Tokaido Tsuchiyama post town, the highway must have been used as the shortest route to Hokkoku.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since there is a 'to the right, Hokkoku Taga Highway, Hino Hachiman Road' road sign in the Tokaido Tsuchiyama post town, the highway must have been used as the shortest route to Hokkoku.

sen.j: 現在この街道の役割を引き継いでいるのは、道路では、県道52号線、同45号線、同46号線、国道477号線、滋賀県道41号線等、鉄道では近江鉄道本線ということになる。
sen.e: The roads that inherited the role of this highway are routes 52, 45, 46 (prefectural roads), route 477 (national highway), and Shiga Prefecture route 41, and the railway that runs the route is Oumi Railway.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: The roads that inherited the role of this highway are Routes 52, 45, 46 (prefectural roads), Route 477 (national highway), and Shiga Prefecture Route 41, and the railway that runs the route is Oumi Railway.

The roads that inherited the role of this highway are Routes 52, 45, 46 (prefectural roads), Route 477 (national highway), and Shiga Prefecture Route 41, and the railway that runs the route is Oumi Railway.

sen.j: しかし、近江鉄道は日野から笹尾峠を通らずに甲賀市水口町貴生川へ向かっている。
sen.e: However, Oumi Railway runs from Hino to Kibukawa, Minakuchi-cho, Koka City without going through Sasao-toge Pass.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理
sen.e: However, Oumi Railway runs from Hino to Kibukawa, Minakuchi-cho, Koka City without going through Sasao-toge Pass.
However, Oumi Railway runs from Hino to Kibukawa, Minakuchi-cho, Koka City without going through Sasao-toge Pass.
